page.title: 13AN OLD RESIDENT OF STRACHAN
page.content: Mrs Thomson,the{school cleaner,}is a cheerful ,dignified lady with a deep throaty voice.She came to Strachan in 1934 aged 10.Her{father}was too stout to be a fisherman any longer so he{rented a croft}about a mile from school(also was the{Glendye postman) She remembers helping her mother get {water from the well.}They had a wash house with wooden taps and a boiler to heat water for the tin bath.They had {no electric}light.They cooked on a cast iron range.The{only money}their mother got was by selling eggs.They made cheese, had 2 cows,poultry,and 4 horses for carts etc. They all helped their father too. Then there was{still {a shoe makers shop now a stable.}The 1st car she remembers was owned by the minister.{She had her 1st car in '50. She married in '47,returned before{'54 when{electricity came to the village.
